page.title: 12ECOLOGY.
page.content: A conservation area of just over 1 acre is to be established at the end of Moat Farm Lane. Orchids are found here as it is quite boggy with a large pond. Along the bridleway from the end of Broad Lane leading to the church is an extensive badgers set which extends into the fields on the eastern side and has several entrances and exits. The number of rabbits and foxes appear to be increasing as does the number of magpies, pigeons and pheasants. Since the reservoirs and ponds have been cleared and improved Canada geese have been seen in the area. There are also reports of greater numbers of frogs and toads. During 1985 an oil pipe-line from Southampton to the Midlands has been laid through the area in a north/south direction.
